abstract: The Upshot; Pres Obama's Affordable Care Act was designed to simplify Medicaid and make it easier for poor to receive medical care, but law allows states to offer more variations of the program than ever before; though complicated and confusing, researchers can now study variations by regions to see which policies may work.
lead_paragraph: Medicaid has become less uniform and more complicated, with variations across states, but researchers will be able to watch many experiments bloom.
snippet: Medicaid has become less uniform and more complicated, with variations across states, but researchers will be able to watch many experiments bloom.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: The Goal Was Simplicity; Instead, There’s a Many-Headed Medicaid
headline.print_headline: How the New Health Law Failed to Simplify Medicaid
